title: NixOS Package PRs for konsole, plasma-pa, nixos, nixos-generate, iproute2, openssh packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for konsole, plasma-pa, nixos, nixos-generate, iproute2, openssh packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Previously, the iprout2 module used import from derivation for the rt_tables configuration. By using a slim derivation and symlinks instead, this is no longer the case.

    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin

    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage

items.content_html:
Description of changes

ldns is used for validating DNSSEC responses. With ldns enabled, using SSHFP records on DNSSEC signed zones allows connecting to ssh servers with host keys being automatically validated.

items.title: openssh: enable ldns

items.content_html:
Description of changes

As part of a desire to help stabilize flakes, I've made nixos-generate-config create a flake.nix which simply imports the configuration.nix that is already generated as part of nixos-generate-config

The flake.nix looks like this

{
  outputs = { self, nixpkgs }: {
    nixosConfigurations.nixos = nixpkgs.lib.nixosSystem {
      modules = [
        ./configuration.nix
      ];
    };
  };
}

The system is already defined in hardware-configuration.nix, and I attempted many times to find ways to generate the inputs attribute set, containing nixpkgs. However, it seems too brittle to attempt to generate the inputs from nix-instantiate --impure --eval --expr '(import <nixpkgs> {}).lib.trivial.release', since this can return 22.11, which would not be a branch/release that would not exist on Github for NixOS depending on the time of running the script. So I've left the decision up to the nix registry to resolve, by omitting the inputs attribute.

Things done

    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage

items.content_html:
Description of changes

When I first tried running nixos-generate-config on my NixOS install I bumped into this error. I did not think to try as root so I decided to Google the issue.

It seems that I wasn't the only one unsure of how to fix it. There was a post on reddit asking my question. https://www.reddit.com/r/NixOS/comments/yv44zx/comment/iwr7n85/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button

I hope that this improved error will reduce potential confusion.

Things done

N/A: this is not a change to a package
items.title: nixos-generate-config: Add help message when `btrfs subvol` fails for non root user

items.content_html:
Description of changes

I've finally been irritated enough about the nixos-rebuild completion being incorrect this week to finally take a look at fixing this.

The nix-bash-completions project is currently pretty inactive. This is why I've made the completions here in this repo.

I also believe that the completions should benefit from proximity with the implementation, which is why it's living with the nixos-rebuild implementation.

Note that the implementation is bespoke, as (as bad as it sounds) I didn't want to have any licensing issues in "importing" code into this repo directly.

It also calls into the Nix completion to complete some of the options it could complete. For now, I believe only --option has useful completion, but I haven't tested with the flake-centric options.

This is my first time writing a completion, and learning about the intricacies of them, so please advise if I did any faux-pas.

There is technically a breaking change in 61d5040, but given it was entirely and thoroughly broken, I don't think it needs a set of release notes.

items.title: nixos/windmill: init module

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Refactorings from #253876, which were reverted along the rest:

  • Avoid unnecessary content emitted in sudoers
    Previously, things like env_keep+=SSH_AUTH_SOCK were emitted regardless of whether pam_ssh_agent is used, etc.
  • Simplify option definitions, drop useless lib. qualifiers
  • Handle default rules through extraRules, make their options configurable
    Users can now inject rules earlier if needed, control SETENV, etc.

The release notes' change were apparently not reverted when #253876 was rolled back,
so this brings the module's implementation in line with its documented changes too.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • Tested, as applicable:

items.title: nixos/distrobox: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Adds a NixOS module for inadyn.

inadyn does not use a standard configuration file format, so some custom logic is needed to render nix options into a configuration file. Every current option should be correctly handled.

Rather than running as a daemon, inadyn is used in one-shot mode at user-defined intervals, as it will be idle most of the time. The default interval is set to every minute, which is the case when using daemon-mode. I have also tried to harden the service as much as I can.

I have tested this successfully with my personal simple inadyn configuration, but would appreciate it if other users can confirm this module works for them.

Closes #242330, and if merged before 23.11 stable NixOS users shouldn't be without a dyanamic dns client 🥳

  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/statsd: convert to `DynamicUser`
